main event: A Naval Research laboratory guide missile expert and two fellow scientists observed a flying saucer in the sky on June 29, 1947, near White Sands, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was described as a silvery disc moving at a rapid speed,The object was visible for about 30 seconds and was observed by multiple witnesses in a car,The object had no protrusions, giving it a uniform shape similar to a disc or sphere,Observers estimated the object's altitude to be between 6,000 and 10,000 feet,The conclusion from the report suggested the object could have been a balloon.
sighted object: a silvery disc in the sky
witnesses: Naval Research laboratory employees and their spouses
